Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a pit stop”
Reviews.Author: ELVIRASaoPauloBrazil
Reviews.Content: We had a connecting flight very early so we stop by this hotel to dine and sleep. We had a perfect meal in their restaurant, a nice sleep and the shuttle took us to the airport with no hassle at all

Reviews.Title: “Nice...airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: kuuru
Reviews.Content: If you need an inexpensive hotel, close to the airport then I would recommend this place. I was in town for a convention and did not want to pay Downtown Miami hotel prices. The hotel is located in an add area though. Clean rooms, free internet, free parking, decent gym, all what you would come to expect from HIlton Garden Inn. Staff was pleasant and attentive. They had an issue with a non working elevator during my check in but everyone was apologetic and the wait was really only a view minutes. I would stay again for business.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual uncleanliness for a Hilton Garden Inn...”
Reviews.Author: pressguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in March, 2012. We usually look fro Hilton Garden Inns because we find them clean, friendly and affordable. We use them for both business and personal travel. The Hilton Garden in Miami seems to be the exception to the rule as far as cleanliness is concerned. Carpets were filthy. And I'm not that picky! Staff were helpful and moved us to another room. Same thing. My advice? Ask to see your room first.

Reviews.Title: “Ronseal! Does what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: istanbultrip059
Reviews.Content: Hilton are a reliable brand and this hotel is exactly what you would expect, good service, nice room, clean hotel, all the usual hilton stuff. Not the cheapest, not the most expensive, however hilton like showers over baths, ok, but sometimes I like a bath! so a 4 not a 5 :) This Hilton garden inn was located near the airport with a free shuttle service and a wendy's just over the road perfect for a one nighter!

Reviews.Title: “Super comfortable bed, pleasant room”
Reviews.Author: Paul_&_Sanderella
Reviews.Content: We had a great night of sleep, due to the very good beds. The room is very pleasant, good atmosphere, with lot of space and a great bathroom. We felt right at home. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: CalebL
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a few different times, on stay was over a week. I did not consistently have access to a car during my stay, a car would make have mad my stay even better. The hotel is new so the rooms were consistantly in good condition as well as the common areas. I thought the food here was good. Breakfast was included for me ( free for gold or higher with Hilton honors). Had cook to order omelets, fruit, breads, eggs, yogurt etc. Dinner is decent and works in a pinch. I tend to like the places across the street though as I just like to get out for dinner if possible. The van transportation was good, I heard they would take you to a grocery store a couple of mile from the hotel but I never tried. They did have good transportation to the airport and the sim/training facilities nearby. The hotel grounds and pool area were well cared for. They have a pool and Jaccuzi. The business center is a decent size and in good order. 2 computers, and a great full size printer/copier. Not the small size most places make do with. The hotel wifi was decent, but did slow down in the evening. For diner I tried several of the restaurants across the street. Directly across 36th is a Denny's and a Wendy's. Didn't go in either but guessing they are ok. In the shopping center next to the Wendy's is a fantastic Cuban place (back left corner). Inexpensive and large meals, that are very tasty. If you have never tried Cuban food GO THERE,and get the Masas de Purco ( fried pork chunks), tastes awesome and you will have enough for a second meal. I also tried the Peruvian place and the Colombian place. Both are good too. The Peruvian place is a bit more pricey, but the food was good. The Colombian place was good, the dining room is a bit small, but the prices were great and the food good. Both of those are on the right side first floor. There is also an Argentinian restaurant but I did not try it. If you make a left on 36th and go under the express way, there are 2 more good Cuban places, one on each side at the next light. El Tropico on the left side in the shopping center, and the Lating American grill on the right side. Also an Italian place and a sandwich shop on the left. Down just a little further on 36th is a Burger King and a Johnny Corino's on the left. If you like cigars there is a good shop in the shopping center across the street from the hotel. It is on the second floor. They have a good selection, reasonable prices and the people that work there were very knowledgable. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Bad location and dirty carpet”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: I try to stay at Hilton Garden Inn when I travel for business. Tripadvisor rated this hotel good. The location was poor with no place to go locally in what did not seem to be a safe neighborhood. The carpeting in my room was horrible. The worst I have ever seen at a Hilton Garden or any hotel I have stayed in over the past few years. Really surprised since I recommend Hilton Garden Inns overall. I will never stay here again uch better choices in the area at equal rates. Staff was nice perhaps just a bad room?

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Soundproofing - helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rossall
Reviews.Content: At long last I have found a Miami airport hotel which I am happy to stay at again which is also good value for money. The only reason four stars is 1) No porter available to help with luggage. 2) No safe in room 3) Failure to give booked morning alarm call. BUT the good points:- Bedroom was clean, amazingly restful bed, well fitted out and it smelt clean. The efficiency area within the room was also convenient and unobtrusive comprising of microwave, fridge and coffee maker. The food one could buy, within the hotel, for own use was not expensively priced. The amazing thing - the sound proofing. It was only when I went for a stroll outside that I realised that the flights into Miami Airport passed directly over the hotel. I videoed one of the evening flights as my room was on the seventh floor directly under the flight path because my friends will never believe how close the planes come but HOW QUIET it was in the room. I did not hear any noise louder than my A/c and fridge whilst in the room. I also used the gym in the hotel and whilst small compared with some other hotels it was well equipped and clean and stayed open until late. The printer in the business centre did not work, when I tried, but the helpful staff at reception rather than having me wait for a repair to be effected invited me to use their reception printer and computer without any problem. All in all a very enjoyable evening's stay whilst waiting my flight out of MIA....and breakfast was an all you can eat type and I recall about $11...good value. Complimentary airport shuttle is every 45 mins and on time. As I started by saying I have no hesitation in returning to Miami Garden Inn, Miami Airport West when the next opportunity arises. Thanks to Colleen and reception staff...especially the lady with unusual name which I cannot for the life of me remember....bet I will as soon as I post this !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: LAF_20
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel that is close to the Miami airport. Our room was on the 7th floor so we did hear the airplanes quite frequently. This was OK since we were only there for one night on our way to the cruise ship. The staff here was exquisite. They arranged for free shuttle transportation to the nearest factory outlet mall. We spoke to another couple who ventured there by taxi for $25 each way. All it cost us was a $5 tip for the driver. The front desk crew was very likable and friendly. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great night's stay!”
Reviews.Author: conchfritter33050
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night as a stop-over through Miami. We got a great price on the room through the hotel's website. The hotel has plenty of free parking, a friendly, competent staff, the room was immaculate and nicely decorated, comfortable bed, on-site breakfast buffet (we were able to get a reduced price by asking when we checked in), free wireless internet. We definitely would recommend this hotel. As for "be aware" items - it is located very close to the airport, so we did occasionally hear a plane, but not to the point of it being a disturbance. Also the bathroom has a walk-in shower (no tub), which was fine for us. My over-6-ft-tall husband appreciated that the showerhead was mounted high up on the wall, so the water didn't hit him mid-chest (you tall people will know what I'm talking about!!). We would definitely stay here again if we needed a room in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service for short visit”
Reviews.Author: Lauraloha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two night in November 2011. We were post-cruise and enjoying a couple of days visiting friends in Miami before flying out of MIA. We had originally booked at the Homewood Suites next door, but upon check in were told we got moved due to overbooking. That was perfectly fine with me. I found the hotel to be comfortable, clean, conveniently located to all major freeways and the service was cordial and accommodating. Big points for one of the most delicious breakfasts I've ever eaten, seriously. Have the belgian waffle with banana and blueberries. We were comped breakfast for two mornings by the General Manager. I am a Hilton Employee, so I am not sure if breakfast is included in the room rate, but I am fairly sure it is. I was on a special rate and originally upon check-in we were not offered breakfast, but it was given to me later and I appreciate the gesture. The hotel also has free internet, a small but efficient workout room and a pool. We went to Miami Beach both days and were there in less than 15 minutes. We also drove surface streets from Coral Gables and were at the hotel in less than 15 minutes. It's not a beautiful Miami Beach oceanfront hotel, but it was perfectly fine for a short stay. I would stay here again and recommend this to anyone who asks.

Reviews.Title: “Great night's stay at a classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedGoat67
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night prior to our cruise the following day. I searched the internet for perhaps 2 hours before I found this gem and made a reservation months in advance. We were picked up at the airport by the complimentary shuttle. The wait time was about 40 minutes. The front desk clerk was very pleasant and very accomodating. The check in went smoothly and I was even able to make port transfers at the same time ($12 pp).Our room had 2 double beds with adjustable mattresses. The room was very clean and included several pillows for each bed. This hotel has its own restaurant but no complimentary breakfast. However, there is a Dennys and a McDonalds across the street as well as a gas station with a small store where you can get snacks and pop for the cruise ship. There is also a data center with free wifi, an exercise room and a pool w/ hot tub. This hotel also has a plan for storing your car for free while you are on a cruise if you stay only one night. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and anyone looking for a stay prior to a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Hilton Garden Inn”
Reviews.Author: FoodieMama
Reviews.Content: We had just flown in from Hungary and were extremely tired. Our room was ready with the airconditioner already on and the room perfect. The bar was open so we were able to order a nice chicken salad and a glass of wine . The staff was fantastic...very very nice...we'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: wareham_mark
Reviews.Content: We are a couple that like to stay at hotels that are comfortable but at a reasonable price. I have back problems so for me the comfort of the bed is a plus. We were very happy to find out that the room was everything we expected and more, it was spacious, comfortable, clean, the staff was very friendly, and the hotel as a hole was very nice. It has a very nice pool and a hot tub, that sadly we couldn't enjoy since we always arrived late to the hotel. The bed was sooooooo comfortable and the pillows were wonderful, I had one of the best sleep nights in Miami ever.

Reviews.Title: “Good but with a glitch in the service”
Reviews.Author: ScyllaBarranquilla
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel in a rainy day and my GPS took me to the backdoor and I call to the operator in order to open up, they said simply not possible because our security employees can get wet!!! I drove extra 10 mins to get in the main entrance and two days later somebody broke in to my rented car, surely the security guy canÂ´t get wet and the bad guys of course does!

Reviews.Title: “Great for early MIA flights”
Reviews.Author: Roombaguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I had a very early flight out of the Miami airport. I have no complaints at all. Rooms are nice and clean ; although nothing to write home about if you know what I mean. Staff are friendly and there is a shuttle to/from the airport. Free internet in the rooms is included. There are a few restaurants right the other side of the street; very convenient for when you don't feel like eating at the hotel. This hotel is a bit farther from the airport than some of the other properties, but shuttle time we are only talking about 3-4 minutes more, so not a big deal. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Ricz_Ribeiro
Reviews.Content: The location is close to the airport and there are fast foods and convenience stores close, besides that, you will need a car or taxi to get around the city. The hotel offers free shuttle from and to the airport and to one of the malls. That said, I must inform that the staff is incredible nice. They will do everything to help you. I had a very pleasant stay and mostly because of the nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy2551
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay , good service , room clean ,front desk customer service excelent and breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Twice in September 2011”
Reviews.Author: jglopga
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our flight to South America and upon our return. This is very similar to other Hilton Garden Inn hotels. The rooms were nice. The airport shuttle was on time. The only disappointment was that the bathroom only had a shower, no tub. Other than that this is a great place to stay near the airport and they allowed me to leave my car for 10 days with no additional fees, since I was staying when I returned. This saved a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Ewwwww...dirty”
Reviews.Author: tsankawi
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed here. This trip our room, especially bathroom was DIRTY! I took a clean wet wash cloth and wiped step into shower and came away with black moldy dirt...ewwwww. If I hadn't needed a shower so badly after an international flight I wouldn't have taken one...I really considered not getting one. The blanket cover and bed skirt were dirty but the sheets were clean. Clearly the housekeeping supervisor is not monitoring what staff is or is not doing. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mainecoon18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after missed flight because of AA. Was suppose to stay at Hampton Inn Blue Lagoon, but the shuttle driver turned us off by his uncaring, rude behaviour. So we ended up at this property. This hotel is clean, new, breakfast was good, front desk helpful and courteous. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: veronak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, the service was great; however, the bed was terrible. It was like sleeping on concrete, my boy friend I checked out two days earlier and checked into a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “Newer HGI located near the airport”
Reviews.Author: wes74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an entire week on business and definitely enjoyed my stay. This is a newer property, so everything at this hotel is modern and nice. The rooms are very clean and the bed is comfortable. The hotel offers free internet, free parking, and has an outdoor hot tub and pool. The fitness center has a nice selection of equipment and met my needs. The only negative about this hotel is the location. It's adjacent to an industrial area and is located right in the path of a runway. Planes do fly directly overhead from time to time and may produce some jet noise in the rooms, although I didn't find the noise to be that bad. For some reason this hotel considers it an upgrade to get a room facing the airport and downtown.....all you really see is an industrial park so avoid paying for the upgrade and hope you get a pool view instead. I had a car and could drive to shopping and restaurants, but if you stay here without a vehicle you might feel trapped. I would definitely stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff-Lousy Food, Beds and Location”
Reviews.Author: Capital_Mama
Reviews.Content: We cannot understand the amazing reviews for this hotel. The staff at this hotel was very friendly, but it did not make up for the poor quality of the food, the uncomfortable beds and the awful location. The room service meal we ordered was cold and tasteless (they also forgot something and asked us to come down and get it!) The breakfast buffet, which cost $12, was worse than the complimentary meals we usually receive at comparable hotels; my husband and I both thought the eggs were the worst we ever had. Moreover, the beds were not very comfortable and the compressor on our mini-refrigerator was so loud that it woke us up several times in the night. Also, the location of the hotel is only good if you need to be at the airport very early in the morning, but it sounds at though the shuttle is not reliable. The hotel is right in the landing path of the airport. Planes fly directly over the hotel (only a couple hundred of feet above the building). Finally, the hotel is not that close to any nice area, it is also not well marked from the road and it is dangerous to get in and out of; you risk life and limb trying to walk anywhere. Other than the great desk staff, we found the hotel sub-par. Sorry guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: norcalnick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during a recent conference and it was quite pleasant! The hotel is just located off the airport so it's a good 10-15 minute drive, not to mention the hotel does offer complimentary shuttle service. The hotel is fairly new, I'd say it's about 2-3 years old as it looked and even smelled quite fresh. The decor was very modern and contemporary throughout the hotel. The entire front desk staff, from morning to afternoon to evening were all quite friendly and accommodating. But I have to say though when they get busy, they get slammed hard yet they remain calm and pleasant. The room I stayed in was nicely furnished and was pretty spacious. It featured the same amenities you'd expect from every Hilton Garden Inn, such as the adjustable bed, which is so awesome and comfortable, complimentary high speed internet, microwave, mini-fridge, coffee maker and 32" LCD TV. The bathroom however had a stand in shower, where the standing area was the size of a tub so you can literally fit two people in there. The showerhead however was placed rather high and for as tall as I am, I had a hard time adjusting the settings. My only complaint about the room was that the closet was very small, it had two sliding doors so the opening was barely big enough for me to fit my (carry on sized) suitcase in without scuffing the wall. Also, the room I was in faced the industrial area with a view of the airport so, I also experienced quite a bit of the flight path noise, which was pretty much from 7am sharp to about 11pm. A colleague of mine who stayed there too was facing the parking lot and said that she didn't hear the planes. Their restaurants offerings were blah, it was the epitome of hotel food. You know, overpriced and under flavored food. But, since there aren't any restaurants withing walking distance it was either Mc Donald's/Denny's or the hotel...I choose the hotel. The evening restaurant staff could use a bit of attitude improvement. They weren't rude at all, they just could've been a little more attentive and warm & fuzzy. The hotel gets a lot of the leisure travelers that are either staying prior/post cruise, which I learned the hard way as I was hoping to catch their shuttle to the airport but a family was catching it and they had more luggage and oversized souvenirs than people. I told the front desk agent to call a cab for me because there wasn't any room, which she did and told me that they'd pay for it due to the inconvenience. Way to go! I didn't mind paying for it but, that was customer service deluxe in the act! Overall, this hotel was great. If I were back in the Miami area and needed to stay by the airport (and had a car) I'd stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Eskimochick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a typical airport Hilton-clean, comfortable, simple breakfast in the morning. Price was affordable. Customer service was horrible. The shuttle took 45 minutes to arrive after calling for it (you have to call for the shuttle, it does not make scheduled stops, even though they say it does)...the drive to the hotel is only 12 minutes, so not sure why it took so long. We sat on the curb watching other hotel shuttles go by up to 3 times while waiting for our shuttle. The next morning, our scheduled 630am shuttle back to the airport actually left the hotel at 628 (per the front desk clerk)-without our group and another traveller scheduled to be on the shuttle. After arguing with us and why it was our fault that we missed the shuttle that left earlier than the scheduled time, the front desk attendent finally called a cab for us. The restaurant was out of half of the food items on the menu both nights that we stayed there. The rooms were fine, as one would expect with a higher-end chain hotel. The only shining star was Catalina at the front desk, she was the only redeeming quality of our stay! We definitely will not be staying there in the future, due to the ridiculous shuttle and poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, friendly, affordable and leave your car for free!”
Reviews.Author: travelonSC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to the Turks and Caicos. We choose for the first time to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn West Miami Airport the night before our departure. We could not have been more impressed. The room was very nice, clean and nicely appointed. What really sold us on this hotel was the friendliness of the staff. Everyone greets you as soon as you passed by them. We had a cooler of frozen food with us and they cheerfully put it in their freezer for keeping overnight. Another guest ask for a late checkout and the cheerful answer was Of Course! Every time I walked by the front desk they were assisting people with unusual requests, always granting them and never making a guest feel like they were doing a huge favor for them-they seemed genuinly pleased to help. We stayed at the hotel for 120.00 for the night. This was a cruise and stay rate. This included a full cooked to order breakfast, cold cereal bar and fresh fruit. This was normally 11.95 per person but it was included in our rate. We also left our car at the hotel for 2 weeks while we were out of the country and this was also included as well as transfers to and from the airport. We will definitely be back and rec. this to our friends who frequently cruise and fly out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: KyKatella
Reviews.Content: Very close to airport with shuttle. My wife and I stayed here going to - and coming from- a Caribbean destination. Both stays were terrific from the warm greeting checking in to the clean, comfortable rooms. Even the maids were friendly in the morning! We did venture across the highway (very busy until after 7pm) to widen our dinner choices and found an excellent Peruvian restuarant in the strip mall - El Pollo Inka. A diverse menu with some recco's the hotel desk folks made - tasted delicious! Family run and good service too. What I also liked was the free high speed internet - never did get why the HGI's provide it free but you have to spend extra to get it at regular Hilton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and perfectly situated off the 826”
Reviews.Author: robbuaa
Reviews.Content: We spent several days in Miami & Key West before heading off to a family get together in Naples. When my father-in-law visits California for business, he always stays at the Hilton Garden Inn in Mountain View, and he's always raving about it. So given the previous reviews of this chain, we decided to give it a try. Also, i'm a Hilton Honors member, and they had a super saver promotion, which made it a great bargain to stay at. It's also right across the street (albeit a busy one) from Denny's, so it's convenient if you arrive late in the evening and want a bite. The room and bathroom were comfortable. Pillows were a little flat--I needed to double mine over to sleep comfortably. Free internet was good as was the free bottled water. The fitness center and pool closed a bit early though (I think around 10?) Convenient location--close drive to downtown Miami/SoBe. Because there was an Urban/Hip Hop festival going on, we drove to the Santa Clara MetroRail station and took it into downtown instead of trying to look for parking downtown. Then on the day we left, we simply popped on the 826 South, it was pretty much a straight shot down to Key West. Solid hotel and great location--we would definitely come back here again if we were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, excellent location near airport, perfect for pleasure or business travel”
Reviews.Author: daf1032
Reviews.Content: Customer service was priority number one from the first phone call to confirm the reservation to check out. The staff was terrific, the rooms were clean and roomy, the business center and wifi in the rooms worked perfectly, and service in the restaurant was great. Due to the location, there is some noise from takeoffs at the airport depending on which side of the building your room lies, and the AC/heat units are a bit older and a bit noisy, but the hotel has been updated nicely in all other respects and is maintained beautifully inside and out. Breakfast was excellent every day of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel -- but don't trust your GPS...”
Reviews.Author: traveler5659
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for one night after traveling to Miami to plan our son's funeral following his unexpected passing. The staff was immensely helpful and allowed us to check in over the telephone while we were still making reservations. The location is somewhat difficult to get to, and we had to improvise several times, especially since the back entrance is what the GPS found -- but it was lock-gated. Room was adequate and quite roomy; breakfast was a combination cook-to-order and buffet, and the facility overall was up to my expectations. Security patrols 24/7 through the parking lot. Staff was quite accommodating when we cancelled our remaining reservation to move to another location closer to where our son's funeral was to be held (we expected to stay for a week to visit him in Univ. of Miami Hospital) on the other side of town (see Holiday Inn/Suites, Miami/Kendall). I would stay here again if I pass through Miami, simply because of its proximity to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “extremly friendly front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: zerberus1980
Reviews.Content: my family and I stayed at this HGI for two nights and were surprised by the really very warm and friendly welcome of two young ladies at the front desk (unfortunately I can't remember their names). The check in was quick and efficient (the were so nice to offer my son a cookie - without asking). those two young women (from the night-shift) were absolutely perfect in their behavior . The room was clean and the property seemed well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “good choice near miami airport”
Reviews.Author: JupiterFarmer
Reviews.Content: Clean room, comf. bed, quiet, clean pool & hot tub, nice staff. Didn't try breakfast, not included. Shuttle got us to & from airport quickly and without wait, which was actually the reason we chose this place, but I'd recommend it regardless. (Other hotels have shuttle but when you call & ask you find out they run once an hour maybe.) Also $109 rate included parking for the week we were gone, just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: hang
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed for only 1 night, we enjoyed our stay and would stay again. Hotel was clean and rooms were quite large. Staff was helpful. Breakfast was not included.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: theconstantwanderer
Reviews.Content: For a business traveler, this hotel cannot be beat! The staff was exceptional and very friendly, and they had all the amenities you could ask for: Free hi-speed Internet in room, a computer room with business services, modern workout room, comfortable bed, nice restaurant on site. Some people complained about the airport noise, but to be honest with you I was surprised at how few planes I actually heard. I would certainly stay here again! It was a little hard to find at first, but otherwise terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: Pabrro
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives me just what I want and need from a business hotel. The extra touches are truely appreciated: free internet with two ways to connect, easy to access electrical plugs in many locations around the room, spacious walk in shower with a shower head at a decent height. Throw on top the extrememly friendly service and well done breakfast and I would give my stay a 5 out of 5. I marked down the location because it is not really close to anything. The airport was a 10-15 minute drive, but the area around the hotel seems safe enough.

Reviews.Title: “Way above expectation”
Reviews.Author: alleychow
Reviews.Content: We had to find a hotel on the spur of the moment when our reservation at another hotel was not honored. This place is bright, clean, new-appearing. The desk clerk was very friendly. Check in was painless. Free yummy cookies. Large clean heated pool and perfect hot tub. The bed was very comfortable. MUCH nicer than the Holiday Inn Express we stayed at the next night. Only negative is that it is about 2 minutes farther from the other "airport" hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Lousey Food!”
Reviews.Author: Travelchick1983
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel and rooms, etc were good. Spacious, comfortable, quiet. Our only complaint was the food - it was terrible. We went to the Great American Grill for dinner and for starters one of the entrees ordered was not available then when the food arrived it was cold and very unappetizing. Sooo we tried breakfast the following morning - how can you mess up breakfast - well this place can. Selection was very limited - what they did have was premade and had been sitting for quite awhile. In most Hilton Garden Inns they make your hot breakfast as you order it. They were short on utensils and glasses and made no effort to get more. Do not eat here under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice For The Price”
Reviews.Author: Ittybritkitty
Reviews.Content: The room was extremely clean and the furniture and carpet looked new. The beds were very comfortable indeed. Parking is free too ... you have to pay approx $30 for parking if you stay at some of the hotels in the art deco district. THIS ROOM IS GREAT FOR THE PRICE!!!!! We looked at a room in a hotel on Miami Beach which was $30 cheaper ...I wanted to gag it was so bad. You are best off here, near the airport where rates are much cheaper. It is by the airport but you don't really hear the planes. Location was not quite as nice as I was expecting for a Hilton. Dennys just across the road (you have to pay for breakfast). I would definately stay again (if I couldn't find a better bargain) and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “the 'IN' INN”
Reviews.Author: AquaBarb
Reviews.Content: Pre cruise stay at the Hilton Garden Inn w/11 of my closest friends was a great success thanks to the excellent help of Michelle Muslera who assisted w/our reservations, including speaking w/several requesting special needs accommodations and/or had hearing challenges when making thier arrangements. The on-site team who served us when we arrived were the perfect complement to the excellent standard of service we had come to expect from our experience w/Michelle. The breakfast/ship transportation package was an exceptional value w/breakfast being very tasty and well presented w/both serve yourself and custom prepared items on request. All this on the busy ProBowl weekend when flights (including ours) were late due to snow at points of origination. The fresh baked cookies offered at check-in are but another example of the value of going the extra mile to extend a warm welcome home after a stressful journey. Best bed rest ever was the mantra from most of the friends.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with the shuttle, but do stay”
Reviews.Author: LooseButton
Reviews.Content: Waited at the airport for the shuttle, but gave up after half an hour. It wasn't that easy to find out where the shuttle went from in the first place, so my advice is, don't bother with it just go to the blue local taxis (no queue, unlike the yellow district ones) where you will be whisked off to the airport for a flat $14. Once at the hotel, all was fine. Polite staff greeting us at the desk and a good room exactly as we'd requested. Nice Nutrogena toiletries, two very comfortable double beds, desk with a great chair, easy chair, wide screen TV, fridge, microwave (initially surprised by that, but found that you could buy microwave meals downstairs - good idea!), all mod cons really. We ate in the restaurant, which was more snack-bar than haute cuisine, but after a nine hour flight and a dose of jet lag, we didn't really care. The basketball game was on in the bar, which was a bit of a shame as the concert for Haiti was on which would have been good to have heard, but we had a minimal wait for our food and were served with our drinks (a wine and a beer) straight away. Breakfast was very good, a nice selection of hot and cold food and plenty of coffee. We were heading for the port and arranged transport (15 minutes late in the end) and in between whiled away our time going for a little wander around the area (don't bother!) and then by the pool (very nice - do bother!). I would stay here again, and would recommend to others, but would go direct to the taxi rank as $14 was money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel -3 stars - restaurant -1 Star - shuttle - a joke”
Reviews.Author: barbexpat
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Miami airport - phoned the hotel to find out where to pick up the shuttle We waited in the wind and the rain for AN HOUR ! finally got to the hotel -room OK but by now we were too late to eat in hotel restaurant - and we left too early for breakfast After a wonderful holiday in Aruba we were back - once again waiting over an hour for the shuttle Arrived at hotel -massive line to check in (airline crew) Room I had booked and paid for (King ) not available - got a room with 2 beds - TV not working Dinner - restaurant only had 3 people in it -but many guys at the bar watching the "game" on TV Gave our order -one soup - 2 red wines -a pizza to share After 30 mins - I asked -any food please ? told pizza will be ready soon "please could we have the soup and wine ? " 10 mins later we got the soup no wine We asked again for our drinks The waiter did not know where to find the wine !! had to get the lady doing the cooking to come out of the kitchen and pour it for us ! Our pizza finally arrived ONE HOUR after we ordered it ! Breakfast however next morning was fine ! If you want an hotel near the airport -I suggest you forget this one

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Zac1mac1
Reviews.Content: Room was excellent. Front desk help was very friendly and eager to help. Check in took less than 10 minutes. Only negative was prices in the cafe. Did have airplanes flying right over hotel, but you should expect that when you book an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JM11traveler
Reviews.Content: I just stayed overnight at the Hilton Garden Inn Miami Airport West and it was Awesome. From the moment we walked in Pamela at the front desk was VERY nice and accommodating. The hotel is very well maintained and looks brand new. The room had comfy beds and pillows as well as a flat screen TV and even had a mini fridge and microwave. If your in the Doral or Miami Airport area, I'd definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Frog007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 3 year old son. The room was new and big with lots of room for him to run around. The sleeping area and sitting area are separated which made for a lot of space. Neutrogena products in the bathroom were a nice touch. Kind of out of the way from the main attractions of Miami but it's a good place to stay if you want to be close to the airport. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bright Smiles & a Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: milring
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn is a rare find when trying to stay near Miami Srings to visit my sister. The Hotel is conveniet, close to airport, food, & shopping. The moment you arrive the property is clean, well lighted, and very clean. The front desk staff greets you & it is obvious that they have reviewed their guest reservations before I checked in. "Colleen" is just fantastic at the front. She knew all the info, explained every detail & was Nice. The room, hallways, gym & pool were spotless & made us feel secure from the germ world . The main focal point of this hotel is the lobby, bar, & restaurant area that is a central happy hour meeting place as well as the breakfast venue in the morning. The clientele are mostly business travelers & airline personnel. Given that information the regard from all the staff is that they are greeting you as a professional. Great Coffee, Great Evolution Bed and Plush clean smelling towels. It is really nice to get out of the pool or hot tub & have blue striped towels waiting for you. The bathroom products are Neutrogena & were very well stocked. The fitness room has a clean bathroom & Blue Crystal Water cold water dispenser with cups. The breakfast is run by the real kitchen with a real cook & wait staff. The beginning buffet is simply self serve with real fruit, juice, & the usual breakfast fare. We were impressed with the staff & the nighttime security in the parking lot. For convenience you park right up on the building and all is real close. It helps that the Hilton Homewood suites sister property is adjoining on the west side. We felt safe and relaxed usiung the pool area at night. we will definitely stay here again. Colleen & Brian make this place a service oriented great place to stay. thankyou & enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Clean and with comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: sollysmom
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this one. Shuttle service from airport was prompt. Didn't have to wait long, and the driver was very nice. Hotel staff was friendly. Breakfast buffet was good and the beds were very comfortable and the hotel was clean. The only negative was that we had to walk across the street, which was very busy, to find a place to eat for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean! Helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: DOC_in_AL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a layover. I must admit that this was a nice surprise. Hotel was relatively new and very clean. Shuttle bus driver Ivan took us to a restaurant for free (although we tipped him). I would definately stay here again if I needed to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Hope a plane doesn't crash into though!”
Reviews.Author: triphelper4u
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was top notch for a HGI! Smells new...great linens...decent buffet...will stay here again. The bed is like a memory foam, so be prepared if that's not your thing as it can feel quite different. The only downside is that the hotel is near the foot of the MIA runway and you see large jets fly what appears to be within 500 ft of the hotel's roof (which you can hear in your room quite nicely). I can only imagine if the pilot was a bit off course! Otherwise, great hotel! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Great, Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ROWM2002
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was fantastic. The room was wonderful. The bed was great. I really like this hotel. The staff was professional and nice. They made sure my stay was comfortable. The wait staff for breakfast was fantastic. I just loved this hotel. The next time I'm in the area, I plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: lawyer86
Reviews.Content: It has an ideal location. 20 min away from the main shopping area and 15 min away from the airport! The hotel had outdoor sports which was nice. Asmallbus from the Hilton picked us up from the airport. The continental breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent everything, Airport Shuttle a little slow, but recommend”
Reviews.Author: ChaseTB
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in May, Night of the 9 and night of the 17. I arrived 10:15pm at MIA and called the Hilton. Took about 1 hr for the shuttle to arrive, but once we were on the shuttle took about 10/15 mins to get to the brand new Hilton Garden Inn. Hotel was no longer serving food at about midnight so went to the Dennys across the seat. Only problem nothing really close by, just a Dennys, McD's and Wendys. Super Clean Rooms, Excellent Beds (like a dream), super nice rooms. Service was excellent, front desk knew my name on arrival cause of calling from the Airport. I then went on my CRUISE for 7 nights, and came back to the Hilton. Stay Again was excellent. Let me check in 1 hours early, (no extra fee). Went swimming in the clean pool. Had a quick dinner at the grill. One place where service was so, so. If I ever travel to Miami without a doubt would stay again at this Hilton. I was a best western person and now have changed to Hilton. ** Do I need to mention the best beds in the world**

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient for airport”
Reviews.Author: janey76
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night whilst in transit through Miami with my cousin. When I arrived at the airport, I had to wait a little while for the shuttle to arrive, but unfortunately it didn't turn up at all for my cousin so she had to pay $20 to get a taxi to the hotel (not ideal when travelling alone late at night). Aside from this, the stay at the hotel was very pleasant. The receptionist (Pamela?) was exceptionally helpful and even managed to remember the guests names and details, which I wouldn't expect from a hotel of this size. The room was really great - very clean and nicely decorated. The food in the restaurant was good, and reasonable value and they have a separate small shop where you can buy snacks and drinks. Overall I think this is a good choice for an airport hotel, and at $130 a night it is very good value compared with some of the other options in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TWKMI
Reviews.Content: This place is new. The staff is excellent. The rooms were very comfortable. The location was perfect for us to spend the night before we flew out to our cruise. The Manager was very helpful ( Todd Armstrong ). He allowed us to park their while we on our cruise and was genuinely concerned about us being pleaed with our stay. I highly recommend staying here and would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and airport view!”
Reviews.Author: SWDurham
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected for a one night stay post cruise. I made a prepaid reservation on the Hilton website for a two bed room. My Honors requests were met, top floor, away from elevator, with an early check in. Upon our 1030AM check in, our room was ready, and the front desk clerk advised us that we could partake of the complimentary breakfast buffet being served until 11AM. (No need for vouchers) Our room 728, faced the airport, and provided an awesome view of incoming aircraft. A midday nap was easy, as the AC went quickly down to a chilly 65 which we LOVE. The beds were plush, with crisp white linens. I noticed that the bathroom amenities were Neutrogena, including mouthwash! The very large flat panel TV was beautiful as were the furnishings. Of course, the hotel had only been open since fall 2008. Used the FREE business center computers to check email and surf the web, and print out our boarding passes. I understand WiFi is complimentary throughout the facility. Pool looked nice, but we didn't have time. Did not use the airport shuttle as we used Alamo rental car. BTW Alamo picked us up for FREE at the Port of Miami. No need to use expensive taxis. Just be sure to get on the MIA Alamo shuttle, not the South Beach Alamo van! The area to the east is typical Miami, to the west are newer and wealthier suburbs.

Reviews.Title: “Area so bad we moved to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasEchotech
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new but the price was very high with no breakfast included. The shuttle took forever to come to the airport and get us we almost gave up and took a cab. But worst of all is the location, it was just plain scary and downright unsafe. We left after one night and moved to another hotel a few miles away where we enjoyed the rest of our 10 days in Miami. Skip this place, theres plenty better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Base”
Reviews.Author: caloversmf
Reviews.Content: Loved the suites - they were very clean and the front desk was extremly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than typical HGI”
Reviews.Author: wearehome
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect big city hotel staff to be this friendly. Almost all employees smiled and greeted my family. Especially, one employee named Pam went beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable by talking with us and even offered complimentary amenity. She made real positive impression of the hotel and the Miami. Room was spacious and the whole property was clean and fresh. It is right next to another Hilton brand hotel Homewood Suites and whole property is semi gated and has plenty of free parking. Price of hotel breakfast is about twelve dollars but is well worth it. My children enjoyed heated, clean, spacious swimming pool. Location is what you might expect from a near airport hotel and the area reflects that. Which means nowhere scenic or serene. My family really had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back.”
Reviews.Author: outidej
Reviews.Content: Thought pretty highly of my stay here in October. The place had not lost its new hotel smell. The service was pretty good. My only request â€” for a Miami Herald â€” was not met, but the guy at the front desk went above and beyond what I'd expect for him to track one down, calling across the street to the gas station, which had already sold out their copies (I settled for a complimentary USA Today). I did use the business center to print out my plane ticket, and the PCs in there were nice. I had no trouble printing out the ticket. Internet service in the room presented no trouble for my Mac laptop. The rooms were very nice and clean. The TV screens were large, new plasmas. The bathroom was very clean. The bed, apparently adjustable, was plenty comfortable, though I didn't tinker with the settings. The food in the downstairs restaurant was maybe a little expensive but what you'd expect at a Hilton. I had breakfast the morning I checked out and was satisfied with the quality. While the hotel is quite close to the airport, it's near the end opposite of the airport's entrance so give yourself at least 15 minutes even without traffic. The location is apparently sketchy, and there's two entrances. The back entrance is closed at night, I found out. When I called over to the front desk, they said they began locking the back gate a week before after some break-ins, though, to their credit, they had a security vehicle manned all night, it seemed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suites”
Reviews.Author: DiscoveryTraveler
Reviews.Content: Lots of space with the suites. Friendly staff. Rooms were clean and new. Very good rest. Not the greatest area of town (close to factories and warehouses), but felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-flight hotel”
Reviews.Author: gocougsBellingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton Garden Inn the night before our return flight home. I am a very picky traveler especially regarding hotels and I found this property to be very nice for this category hotel. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Beds were some of the most comfortable we have experienced at any hotel, including higher end hotels. Our best night of sleep on our 11 day trip. Great pool for this size hotel. Breakfast in the morning was very good, with excellent service. We had breakfast included in our rate of $137 per night for 2 adults, 2 children. Hotel is a little further away from the airport than other hotels such as the Embassy Suites, but only by about 5-10 mins. Not many restaurants in the immediate area other than fast food. As there is freeway access right outside the entrance to the hotel, we chose an italian restaurant Buca Di Beppo for dinner. It is about 15 min. North on the freeway. Dinner was quite good with large portions and is in a very nice area. Hotel can give you directions. When we come back for our next cruise, would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirldi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the evening before our cruise. They provided transportation from the airport. They advertised 24 hour shuttle but because of being brand new, they didn't have the need for a 24 hour shuttle so when we called the hotel upon our airport arrival, they had us take a cab. We pulled up to the hotel and they paid the driver. Check in was fast efficient and friendly. Rooms were perfectly clean and beds were comfortable. Originally I was concerned about airport noise but there wasn't any. Rooms were quiet. For the breakfast the next morning, we walked right across the street to Dennys. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bryan_m36
Reviews.Content: A brand new hotel. So what can you expect. Only the best. From check-in to check-out, everything went smoothly. Staff was exceptionally friendly. As a Diamond member from Hilton, I was very sattisfied with this stay. This was my first but certainly not the last visit to the HGI. Room was nicely decorated with flat screen tv. The bed was great. Breakfast was very good. No complaints at all. Highly recommended and good location. Several junkfood chains near the hotel, So food wise you are not going to have problems.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Garden Inn Miami Airport West
HotelInfo.Address: 3550 NW 74th Avenue, Miami, FL 33122
